A wave can wash up onto the surface of rock or soil and then carry away pieces of material as it flows back into the ocean or lake.The size of earth materials that can be moved by water depends on how fast the water is moving. A fast-flowing stream can carry large rocks while a slow-moving stream might only be able to carry very small things like clay. Canyons are among the most obvious features made by erosion.
